meanings.definition: To put oneself deliberately into a place or situation where one is unwelcome or uninvited.
meanings.sent1: The curious cat intruded into the neighbor's garden.
meanings.sent2: The stranger intruded into the private meeting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel intruded into the bird feeder again.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise intruded into the peaceful silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The bright light intruded into the dark room, startling everyone.

meanings.definition: To thrust or bring in without invitation, permission, or welcome.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind intruded through the open window.
meanings.sent2: The unwanted thoughts intruded into her mind.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain intruded on our picnic, but we still had fun.
meanings.sent4: The smell of burnt popcorn intruded into the movie theater.
meanings.sent5: The loud music intruded on the peaceful atmosphere of the library.

meanings.definition: To enter as an uninvited or unwelcome visitor.
meanings.sent1: The raccoon intruded into the backyard looking for food.
meanings.sent2: The uninvited guest intruded into the party and caused a scene.
meanings.sent3: The annoying fly intruded on our outdoor lunch.
meanings.sent4: The unwanted memories intruded into her mind at unexpected times.
meanings.sent5: The loud laughter intruded into the serious meeting, causing everyone to pause.
